content: I think I've asked this before but it likely got lost in Gitter's back scroll: I'm planning to add a dependency to Paragraphs but I'm unsure the recommended way to do this. Will the upgrade process handle this? (ie. if Paragraphs is installed without the new dependency and someone tries to upgrade through the Project Installer, will it force download/enable the new dependency first, before upgrading the Paragraphs module? Otherwise we'll crash sites upon upgrade).
I can do some testing with manual upgrades but can't really test the Project Installer until I've made a new release.
So I'm hoping someone has some insight on that. :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
I'd be interested to know too. I suspect that the updater checks the dependencies when it checks the info file of the module
If the module is already in place, it should enable it for you. I don't think it will download it if it's not there, but I have tried that.

Haven't tested through the UI yet (since I haven't released an update with a dependency) but did a quick test updating through the filesystem directly: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/paragraphs/issues/48#issuecomment-592512816
